@graph.title: The Routledge Hispanic studies companion to nineteenth-century Spain
abstract: "The Routledge Hispanic Studies Companion to Nineteenth Century Spain brings together an international team of expert contributors in this critical and innovative volume that redefines 19th century Spain in a multi-national, multi-lingual and transnational way. This interdisciplinary volume examines questions related to the field of cultural studies moving beyond the traditional concept of Spain as a singular, homogenous entity to a new understanding of Spain as an unstable set of multipolar and multilinguistic relations that can be inscribed in different translational ways. This invaluable resource will be of interest to advanced students and scholars in Hispanic Studies"--

Politics, affect, and the negotiations of gender in Concepción Arenal's antislavery writings / Akiko Tsuchiya -- "Los que no pueden ser otra cosa" : nineteenth-century State arts administration and Spanish identity / Oscar E. Vázquez -- The dream of a Federal Republic : Unites States independence as a model for Rossend Arús i Arderiu's activism and freemason ideology / Aurélie Vialette

Rethinking the nineteenth century and Spain : critical configurations / Elisa Martí-López -- Caribbean siblings : sisterly affinities and differences between Cuba and Puerto Rico in the nineteenth century / Silvia Álvarez Curbelo -- Good Spanish, better Basques : culture, politics, and identity construction in the Basque diaspora of the nineteenth century / Óscar Álvarez Gila -- The Cors Clavé : popular music, republicanism, and social regeneration / Jaume Ayats and Anna Costal -- Health policies and liberal reforms / Josep L. Barona -- Equatorial Guinea : colonization and cultural dislocation (1827-1931) / Justo Bolekia Boleká -- Global Hispanophone cultural production in the nineteenth-century Maghreb and the Ottoman Empire / Adolfo Campoy-Cubillo -- Fortuny and the Spanish-Moroccan War (1859-1860) : battle paintings and orientalist pictorial production / Jordi Àngel Carbonell Pallarés --

The Philippines in the context of the nineteenth-century Spanish Empire / María Dolores Elizalde -- Nineteenth-century realism and political economy : the plot against the equation / Luis Fernández-Cifuentes -- Colonial wars, gender, and the nation in nineteenth-century Spain : soldiers' writings, metropolitan views / Albert Garcia-Balañà -- Guidebooks, panoramas, and architecture : competing national constructions in Catalonia and Spain / Josep-Maria Garcia-Fuentes -- Navigating stereotypes and perceptions of Spain / Claudia Hopkins -- Partial protagonists : biography, fiction, and the nineteenth-century legacy in Rosa Chacel and Benjamín Jarnés / Geraldine Lawless -- Posterity and periphery in late nineteenth-century Galicia / Helena Miguélez-Carballeira -- Urbanisation in upheaval : Spanish cities, agents and targets of a slow transformation / Jesús Mirás Araujo -- Spain and the visual culture of suffering / Javier Moscoso --

Recreating the homeland abroad : migrants, settlers, and the Iberian identities in the Americas, 1870-1920 / Xosé M. Núñez Seixas -- Ruins of civilization : the classics at the foundation of Iberian nationalisms / Joan Ramon Resina -- Y ahora seremos españoles : the uncertainties of Puerto Rican identity in the late Spanish Empire / Wadda C. Ríos-Font -- The legacies of Atlantic slavery in nineteenth-century Spain / Martín Rodrigo y Alharilla -- Women in nineteenth-century paintings : an imaginary album of daily life / Teresa-M. Sala -- Theater spaces in Barcelona, 1800-1850 / Gabriel Sansano -- Education and citizenship in the construction of the Spanish State : from the Constitution of Cádiz to the creation of the Ministry of Public Education (1812-1900) / Mario Santana & Antonio Pérez García -- The Yucatan Channel and the limits of "Spain" in the mid-nineteenth century / Lisa Surwillo --
